#summary The client downloads a .torrent file (and the actual torrent, or should this be another use case?)

= Introduction =

The user queries the server for the .torrent file and downloads it if it is there.


= Details =
1. User selects file in file browser portion of program
2. User selects download
3. Client sends out a request to the server for the .torrent file
          4. Server returns status of .torrent file
5. If .torrent file is available, client downloads it
6. Client performs checksum on .torrent file to make sure it was transferred successfully
7. Client queries tracker to get list of other clients with file or files defined by .torrent file
          8. Tracker adds client to list of clients downloading file
9. Client queries other clients to find out who had what pieces of file or files
          10. Other clients reply and specify what data is available for download
11. Client downloads files piece by piece
